Control Number and Name:
A.4.2 Resource documentation
A.4.3 Data resources
A.4.4 Tooling resources
A.4.5 System and computing resources
A.4.6 Human resources

Template.text: Verify that all testing activities are performed using only the approved and documented resources (data, tools, hardware) and personnel, all within the specified, secure computing environment to ensure repeatable and consistent results.

Control Number and Name:
A.7.4 Quality of data
A.7.5 Data provenance

Template.text: Confirm that all validation datasets are high quality, complete, and representative. Crucially, document and verify the provenance of this data to ensure it is entirely independent of the training data.

Control Number and Name: A.9.4 Intended use of the AI system
A.9.3 Objectives for responsible use of AI system

Template.text: Conduct rigorous tests to validate that the AI system not only performs reliably according to its intended purpose but also meets all predefined objectives for fairness, transparency, and other responsible AI metrics.

Validate that all user and system documentation is accurate and reflects the tested behavior. Ensure all V&V tasks, including those by third-party suppliers, are performed in alignment with the documented responsibility matrix (RACI).

Establish and maintain the overall plan for system operation, including procedures for monitoring, updates, and support. Actively enforce governance processes and ensure all parties adhere to their documented responsibilities.

Control Number and Name: A.4.x

Template.text: Continuously monitor the health, performance, and cost of all production resources, including infrastructure, data sources, and software tools. Ensure designated teams are actively maintaining the system and applying necessary updates.

Implement continuous monitoring to track data quality, detect drift, and log data provenance for critical decisions. Actively monitor the AI model's performance against its responsible AI objectives (e.g., fairness, bias) and check for signs of misuse.

Execute the predefined incident communication process for any significant system failure or breach. Manage all required external reporting and ensure all user-facing documentation is continuously updated to reflect system changes.

Establish a process to feed operational data and customer feedback back into the development cycle for future enhancements. Continuously monitor supplier performance to manage risks and ensure service quality.
